Question
========

A survey of people with depression asks (among other things) asked questions about sports and partnership. Of the 200 interviewees 120 participate in sports and there are 50 interviewees who participate in sports and have no partner. The probability that a randomly drawn person in this survey plays sports and has a partner is equal to

Answerlist
----------

* 0.35.
* 0.60.
* 0.75.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.35.: Correct
* 0.60.: Incorrect
* 0.75.: Incorrect
